info.name: Sila API Request Collection
info.description: Makes requests to a local proxy server, which creates signature headers for those requests, then forwards them to the requested local or remote host (header `X-FORWARD-TO-URL`).

item.name: Local Helpers

request.description: Generates a private key/address pair (ETH).
Generates a private key/address pair (ETH).
Signs the contents of the request body with the private key in the X-PRIVATE-KEY header.

item.description: These are functions on the local proxy server to be used as helpers. They can generate signatures and private keys and spit out current epoch.

query.description: You can use "address" or "blockchain_address" to make this request.

request.description: Simple request to get token balance at a blockchain address. Requires no authentication. Can be a POST or a GET. Either POST an "address"/"blockchain_address" in a JSON request body or put it in a query parameter in a GET request.
